description:
gTech’s Product and Tools Operations team (gPTO) leverages deep user, operational, and technical insights to innovate Google's Ads products into customer experiences that are so intuitive (or automated) that they require no support at all. gPTO partners closely with gTech’s Support, Professional Services, Product Management, and Engineering teams to innovate and simplify our Ads products and build the productivity tools ecosystem for gTech users.

The Google Shopping team is building the next generation shopping experiences for consumers.

The Transactions team within Product and Tools Operations empowers the ecosystem across Engineering, Product Management and Partners to make Google Express work. We provide end-to-end technical, operational and relationship support for partners, including influencing product strategy, developing scalable product tools, helping onboard new partners, providing technical implementation services to our strategic partners and ongoing partner management.

As Manager, you will be responsible for improving the availability and transactability of inventory on Google Express. You will manage a high performing team of Business and Technical Analysts who enrich product detail pages by leveraging diverse sources of content, minimize errors in the product catalog and improve inventory availability by forecasting seasonality and identifying new sources of inventory. You will leverage cross-functional relationships with Product Catalog Engineering teams to improve and externalize catalog metadata, seeking opportunities to partner with internal and external teams to improve product content, while working with the Operations teams to utilize new sources of data to improve item availability.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of relevant work experience
  • 2 years of experience in people management.
  • Experience leading and implementing projects including partnering with cross-functional leaders.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree, Master's degree or PhD in a STEM field.
  • Experience in online commerce and/or retail.
  • Experience working on globally distributed teams and managing teams with diverse backgrounds to execute on a shared vision.
  • Experience analyzing and presenting data.
  • Ability to work well in a fast-paced cross-functional team environment.
  • Excellent oral and written communication, interpersonal and analytical skills.
responsibilities:
• Manage a high-performing team that engages across diverse focus areas, while ensuring the successful engagement and retention of talent.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders on business planning, key organizational metrics and other operationally strategic projects. Work closely with leaders to develop operational business reviews and team communications.
  • Create a vision for inventory and data quality that will motivate your team and align the efforts of cross-functional teams in Product Management and Engineering.
  • Identify and structure specific analyses to address complex, ambiguous business challenges.
  • Assist with complex and difficult escalations in close collaboration with leads and cross-functional teams.
title: Manager, Inventory and Data Quality, Product and Tools Operations
